itemdesc-wildseeds-*: Plant these in soil to grow.
itemdesc-burlapsack: Adds 10 slots that can only hold seeds, plants, and crops.
botanyguide-text:
The Botanist Hand Guide

Seed Extraction And Plant Reproduction

Seeds from grain can be extracted by putting it into a crafting grid with a wooden pan. Seeds from vegetables and legumes can be extracted using shears in the crafting grid. Reed tops and vine tips can be grown and split into two by putting them in the crafting grid with a full bucket of water. Place vine tips up somewhere high, and the tip will grow down leaving vine sections you can harvest. Place seaweed trimmings in deep water and they will grow up, leaving seaweed you can harvest Seeds for flowers, fruits, cacti, and fern can be extracted with a knife in the crafting grid. These seeds do not require farmland or water, but they are sensitive to temperature and will get a heat boost in a greenhouse. Pine and acacia trees can be scored with a knife to leak resin.

Mushroom Farming

To start farming mushrooms you will need mushroom substrate and the mushroom you want to grow. Right clicking on the substrate with the mushroom will set it. For ground mushrooms, they will grow with in 7 blocks of the substrate randomly on dirt that is on the same level as the substrate. For side growing mushrooms place 5 logs on top of the substrate that match the mushrooms preferred type and they will grow on the sides of the log.

Tree Farming

All saplings/trees have specific needs in order to grow them. They must all in a certain temperature range. The trunk of the tree will tell you if it is too hot or too cold. Trees will regenerate leaves if they meet the above criteria and the place where the leaves should go is not blocked. Tree health is 50% based on the amount of leaves and 50% based on the health of the wood. Breaking or blocking leaves will reduce its leaf health. Parasites like termites will reduce its log health. Trees grow into the next stage if they have at least 85% health. Leaves and branches will regenerate BUT destroying a log will kill the tree and the trunk will die and turn into a regular log. Fully grown trees will attract different flora and will plant more saplings in the area if at least 75% health. Be careful though, as fully grown trees can also attract harmful organisms like termites. Note: Bamboo and fern trees are not “living”.

Types of Trees:

Birch
Type: Deciduous
Minimum Temperature: -7,
Maximum Temperature: 39

Oak
Type: Deciduous
Minimum Temperature: -5,
Maximum Temperature: 40

Maple
Type: Deciduous
Minimum Temperature: -7,
Maximum Temperature: 40

Pine
Type: Conifer
Minimum Temperature: -18,
Maximum Temperature: 30

Acacia
Type: Non-Standard
Minimum Temperature: 21,
Maximum Temperature: 50,

Kapok
Type: Tropical
Minimum Temperature: 20,
Maximum Temperature: 50,

Larch
Type: Conifer
Minimum Temperature: -24,
Maximum Temperature: 15,

Redwood
Type: Conifer
Minimum Temperature: 7,
Maximum Temperature: 35

Bald Cypress
Type: Conifer
Minimum Temperature: 8,
Maximum Temperature: 41

Ebony
Type: Confier
Minimum Temperature: 21,
Maximum Temperature: 50

Purpleheart
Type: Tropical
Minimum Temperature: 20,
Maximum Temperature: 50

Walnut
Type: Deciduous
Minimum Temperature: -1,
Maximum Temperature: 39

Green Bamboo
Type: Non-Standard
Minimum Temperature: 27,
Maximum Temperature: 50,
Note: Produces many rhizomes, give plenty of space

Brown Bamboo
Type: Non-Standard
Minimum Temperature: 22,
Maximum Temperature: 50,
Note: Produces many rhizomes, give plenty of space

Fern Tree
Type: Non-Standard
Minimum Temperature: 19,
Maximum Temperature: 50,
Note: Produces many rhizomes, give plenty of space
msubstrate-barren: Add a mushroom to this block to begin incubating it.
MaxTreeGrowthStages-Comment: How many times trees grow until they are fully mature.
FernRepopRate-Comment: This percentage of ferns will actually be planted.
PropogateIntoWater-Comment: Propogate plants and saplings into water.
PropogateIntoClaims-Comment: Propogate plants and saplings into land claims (i.e. traders).
SeedlingGrowthRateMultiplier-Comment: Increase this number to speed up seedling growth rate. Only applies to newly planted seeds.
GrownTreeRepopMinimum-Comment: Minimum range trees will plant saplings and max range for foilage.
GrownTreeRepopVertSearch-Comment: How far up and down the tree looks to plant something.
SaplingToTreeSize-Comment: Starting size of trees grown from saplings.
TreeSizePerGrowthStage-Comment: How much bigger the tree gets with every growth stage.
TreeRevertGrowthTempThreshold-Comment: How much colder or hotter the tree can get past its min and max temperature before growth and regeneration resets.
TreeRegenMultiplier-Comment: Speed at which trees regenerate leaves.
TreeRepopChance-Comment: Chance the tree plants a sapling.
TreeFoilageChance-Comment: Chance the tree encourages forest foilage.
TreeFoilageTriesPerDay-Comment: How many times the tree will try to plant forest foilage if it cannot find a suitable spot.
HarshWildPlants-Comment: If disabled, wild plants will ignore temperature.
FlowersEnabled-Comment: If enabled seeds for flowers can be crafted.
SeedPanningEnabled-Comment: If enabled muddy gravel can be panned for shells and seeds.
BushSeedsEnabled-Comment: Seeds for bushes can be made (Note: Automatically disables self if Wildcraft mod is installed).
CactiSeedsEnabled-Comment: Seeds for cacti can be made.
MushroomFarmingEnabled-Comment: Starter cultures for mushrooms can be made.
VineGrowthEnabled-Comment: Vines will grow with this enabled.
LogScoringEnabled-Comment: Pine and acacia logs can be cut to leak resin.
LivingTreesEnabled-Comment: Trees will have dynamic needs and growth stages.
HarshSaplingsEnabled-Comment: When enabled saplings will require the same thing as trees. When disabled it will use vanilla mechanics.
ResinGrowthEnabled-Comment: If enabled resin may appear on grown trees.
